00057 static int ll_create_it(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dentry,
00058                         struct lookup_intent *it);
00059 
00060 /* called from iget5_locked->find_inode() under inode_lock spinlock */
00061 static int ll_test_inode(struct inode *inode, void *opaque)
00062 {
00063         struct ll_inode_info    *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
00064         struct lustre_md        *md = opaque;
00065 
00066         if (unlikely(!(md->body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLID))) {
00067                 CERROR("MDS body missing FID\n");
00068                 return 0;
00069         }
00070 
00071         if (!lu_fid_eq(&lli->lli_fid, &md->body->mbo_fid1))
00072                 return 0;
00073 
00074         return 1;
00075 }
00076 
00077 static int ll_set_inode(struct inode *inode, void *opaque)
00078 {
00079         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
00080         struct mdt_body *body = ((struct lustre_md *)opaque)->body;
00081 
00082         if (unlikely(!(body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLID))) {
00083                 CERROR("MDS body missing FID\n");
00084                 return -EINVAL;
00085         }
00086 
00087         lli->lli_fid = body->mbo_fid1;
00088         if (unlikely(!(body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLTYPE))) {
00089                 CERROR("Can not initialize inode "DFID" without object type: "
00090                        "valid = "LPX64"\n",
00091                        PFID(&lli->lli_fid), body->mbo_valid);
00092                 return -EINVAL;
00093         }
00094 
00095         inode->i_mode = (inode->i_mode & ~S_IFMT) | (body->mbo_mode & S_IFMT);
00096         if (unlikely(inode->i_mode == 0)) {
00097                 CERROR("Invalid inode "DFID" type\n", PFID(&lli->lli_fid));
00098                 return -EINVAL;
00099         }
00100 
00101         ll_lli_init(lli);
00102 
00103         return 0;
00104 }
00105 
00106 
00111 struct inode *ll_iget(struct super_block *sb, ino_t hash,
00112                       struct lustre_md *md)
00113 {
00114         struct inode    *inode;
00115         int             rc = 0;
00116 
00117         ENTRY;
00118 
00119         LASSERT(hash != 0);
00120         inode = iget5_locked(sb, hash, ll_test_inode, ll_set_inode, md);
00121         if (inode == NULL)
00122                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00123 
00124         if (inode->i_state & I_NEW) {
00125                 rc = ll_read_inode2(inode, md);
00126                 if (rc == 0 && S_ISREG(inode->i_mode) &&
00127                     ll_i2info(inode)->lli_clob == NULL)
00128                         rc = cl_file_inode_init(inode, md);
00129 
00130                 if (rc != 0) {
00131                         /* Let's clear directory lsm here, otherwise
00132                          * make_bad_inode() will reset the inode mode
00133                          * to regular, then ll_clear_inode will not
00134                          * be able to clear lsm_md */
00135                         if (S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode))
00136                                 ll_dir_clear_lsm_md(inode);
00137                         make_bad_inode(inode);
00138                         unlock_new_inode(inode);
00139                         iput(inode);
00140                         inode = ERR_PTR(rc);
00141                 } else {
00142                         unlock_new_inode(inode);
00143                 }
00144         } else if (!(inode->i_state & (I_FREEING | I_CLEAR))) {
00145                 rc = ll_update_inode(inode, md);
00146                 CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "got inode: "DFID"(%p): rc = %d\n",
00147                        PFID(&md->body->mbo_fid1), inode, rc);
00148                 if (rc != 0) {
00149                         if (S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode))
00150                                 ll_dir_clear_lsm_md(inode);
00151                         iput(inode);
00152                         inode = ERR_PTR(rc);
00153                 }
00154         }
00155 
00156         RETURN(inode);
00157 }
00158 
00159 static void ll_invalidate_negative_children(struct inode *dir)
00160 {
00161         struct dentry *dentry, *tmp_subdir;
00162         DECLARE_LL_D_HLIST_NODE_PTR(p);
00163 
00164         ll_lock_dcache(dir);
00165         ll_d_hlist_for_each_entry(dentry, p, &dir->i_dentry) {
00166                 spin_lock(&dentry->d_lock);
00167                 if (!list_empty(&dentry->d_subdirs)) {
00168                         struct dentry *child;
00169 
00170                         list_for_each_entry_safe(child, tmp_subdir,
00171                                                  &dentry->d_subdirs,
00172                                                  d_child) {
00173                                 if (child->d_inode == NULL)
00174                                         d_lustre_invalidate(child, 1);
00175                         }
00176                 }
00177                 spin_unlock(&dentry->d_lock);
00178         }
00179         ll_unlock_dcache(dir);
00180 }
00181 
00182 int ll_test_inode_by_fid(struct inode *inode, void *opaque)
00183 {
00184         return lu_fid_eq(&ll_i2info(inode)->lli_fid, opaque);
00185 }
00186 
00187 int ll_md_blocking_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct ldlm_lock_desc *desc,
00188                        void *data, int flag)
00189 {
00190         struct lustre_handle lockh;
00191         int rc;
00192         ENTRY;
00193 
00194         switch (flag) {
00195         case LDLM_CB_BLOCKING:
00196                 ldlm_lock2handle(lock, &lockh);
00197                 rc = ldlm_cli_cancel(&lockh, LCF_ASYNC);
00198                 if (rc < 0) {
00199                         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "ldlm_cli_cancel: rc = %d\n", rc);
00200                         RETURN(rc);
00201                 }
00202                 break;
00203         case LDLM_CB_CANCELING: {
00204                 struct inode *inode = ll_inode_from_resource_lock(lock);
00205                 __u64 bits = lock->l_policy_data.l_inodebits.bits;
00206 
00207                 /* Inode is set to lock->l_resource->lr_lvb_inode
00208                  * for mdc - bug 24555 */
00209                 LASSERT(lock->l_ast_data == NULL);
00210 
00211                 if (inode == NULL)
00212                         break;
00213 
00214                 /* Invalidate all dentries associated with this inode */
00215                 LASSERT(ldlm_is_canceling(lock));
00216 
00217                 if (!fid_res_name_eq(ll_inode2fid(inode),
00218                                      &lock->l_resource->lr_name)) {
00219                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "data mismatch with object "DFID"(%p)",
00220                                    PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode);
00221                         LBUG();
00222                 }
00223 
00224                 if (bits & MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR) {
00225                         if (S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode))
00226                                 ll_i2info(inode)->lli_def_stripe_offset = -1;
00227                         ll_xattr_cache_destroy(inode);
00228                         bits &= ~MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR;
00229                 }
00230 
00231                 /* For OPEN locks we differentiate between lock modes
00232                  * LCK_CR, LCK_CW, LCK_PR - bug 22891 */
00233                 if (bits & MDS_INODELOCK_OPEN)
00234                         ll_have_md_lock(inode, &bits, lock->l_req_mode);
00235 
00236                 if (bits & MDS_INODELOCK_OPEN) {
00237                         fmode_t fmode;
00238 
00239                         switch (lock->l_req_mode) {
00240                         case LCK_CW:
00241                                 fmode = FMODE_WRITE;
00242                                 break;
00243                         case LCK_PR:
00244                                 fmode = FMODE_EXEC;
00245                                 break;
00246                         case LCK_CR:
00247                                 fmode = FMODE_READ;
00248                                 break;
00249                         default:
00250                                 LDLM_ERROR(lock, "bad lock mode for OPEN lock");
00251                                 LBUG();
00252                         }
00253 
00254                         ll_md_real_close(inode, fmode);
00255 
00256                         bits &= ~MDS_INODELOCK_OPEN;
00257                 }
00258 
00259                 if (bits & (MDS_INODELOCK_LOOKUP | MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE |
00260                             MDS_INODELOCK_LAYOUT | MDS_INODELOCK_PERM))
00261                         ll_have_md_lock(inode, &bits, LCK_MINMODE);
00262 
00263                 if (bits & MDS_INODELOCK_LAYOUT) {
00264                         struct cl_object_conf conf = {
00265                                 .coc_opc = OBJECT_CONF_INVALIDATE,
00266                                 .coc_inode = inode,
00267                         };
00268 
00269                         rc = ll_layout_conf(inode, &conf);
00270                         if (rc < 0)
00271                                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "cannot invalidate layout of "
00272                                        DFID": rc = %d\n",
00273                                        PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), rc);
00274                 }
00275 
00276                 if ((bits & MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE) && S_ISDIR(inode->i_mode)) {
00277                         struct ll_inode_info *lli = ll_i2info(inode);
00278 
00279                         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "invalidating inode "DFID" lli = %p, "
00280                                "pfid  = "DFID"\n", PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)),
00281                                lli, PFID(&lli->lli_pfid));
00282                         truncate_inode_pages(inode->i_mapping, 0);
00283 
00284                         if (unlikely(!fid_is_zero(&lli->lli_pfid))) {
00285                                 struct inode *master_inode = NULL;
00286                                 unsigned long hash;
00287 
00288                                 /* This is slave inode, since all of the child
00289                                  * dentry is connected on the master inode, so
00290                                  * we have to invalidate the negative children
00291                                  * on master inode */
00292                                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "Invalidate s"DFID" m"DFID"\n",
00293                                        PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)),
00294                                        PFID(&lli->lli_pfid));
00295 
00296                                 hash = cl_fid_build_ino(&lli->lli_pfid,
00297                                         ll_need_32bit_api(ll_i2sbi(inode)));
00298 
00299                                 /* Do not lookup the inode with ilookup5,
00300                                  * otherwise it will cause dead lock,
00301                                  *
00302                                  * 1. Client1 send chmod req to the MDT0, then
00303                                  * on MDT0, it enqueues master and all of its
00304                                  * slaves lock, (mdt_attr_set() ->
00305                                  * mdt_lock_slaves()), after gets master and
00306                                  * stripe0 lock, it will send the enqueue req
00307                                  * (for stripe1) to MDT1, then MDT1 finds the
00308                                  * lock has been granted to client2. Then MDT1
00309                                  * sends blocking ast to client2.
00310                                  *
00311                                  * 2. At the same time, client2 tries to unlink
00312                                  * the striped dir (rm -rf striped_dir), and
00313                                  * during lookup, it will hold the master inode
00314                                  * of the striped directory, whose inode state
00315                                  * is NEW, then tries to revalidate all of its
00316                                  * slaves, (ll_prep_inode()->ll_iget()->
00317                                  * ll_read_inode2()-> ll_update_inode().). And
00318                                  * it will be blocked on the server side because
00319                                  * of 1.
00320                                  *
00321                                  * 3. Then the client get the blocking_ast req,
00322                                  * cancel the lock, but being blocked if using
00323                                  * ->ilookup5()), because master inode state is
00324                                  *  NEW. */
00325                                 master_inode = ilookup5_nowait(inode->i_sb,
00326                                                     hash, ll_test_inode_by_fid,
00327                                                         (void *)&lli->lli_pfid);
00328                                 if (master_inode != NULL &&
00329                                         !IS_ERR(master_inode)) {
00330                                         ll_invalidate_negative_children(
00331                                                                 master_inode);
00332                                         iput(master_inode);
00333                                 }
00334                         } else {
00335                                 ll_invalidate_negative_children(inode);
00336                         }
00337                 }
00338 
00339                 if ((bits & (MDS_INODELOCK_LOOKUP | MDS_INODELOCK_PERM)) &&
00340                     inode->i_sb->s_root != NULL &&
00341                     inode != inode->i_sb->s_root->d_inode)
00342                         ll_invalidate_aliases(inode);
00343 
00344                 iput(inode);
00345                 break;
00346         }
00347         default:
00348                 LBUG();
00349         }
00350 
00351         RETURN(0);
00352 }
00353 
00354 __u32 ll_i2suppgid(struct inode *i)
00355 {
00356         if (in_group_p(i->i_gid))
00357                 return (__u32)from_kgid(&init_user_ns, i->i_gid);
00358         else
00359                 return (__u32) __kgid_val(INVALID_GID);
00360 }
00361 
00362 /* Pack the required supplementary groups into the supplied groups array.
00363  * If we don't need to use the groups from the target inode(s) then we
00364  * instead pack one or more groups from the user's supplementary group
00365  * array in case it might be useful.  Not needed if doing an MDS-side upcall. */
00366 void ll_i2gids(__u32 *suppgids, struct inode *i1, struct inode *i2)
00367 {
00368         LASSERT(i1 != NULL);
00369         LASSERT(suppgids != NULL);
00370 
00371         suppgids[0] = ll_i2suppgid(i1);
00372 
00373         if (i2)
00374                 suppgids[1] = ll_i2suppgid(i2);
00375         else
00376                 suppgids[1] = -1;
00377 }
00378 
00379 /*
00380  * try to reuse three types of dentry:
00381  * 1. unhashed alias, this one is unhashed by d_invalidate (but it may be valid
00382  *    by concurrent .revalidate).
00383  * 2. INVALID alias (common case for no valid ldlm lock held, but this flag may
00384  *    be cleared by others calling d_lustre_revalidate).
00385  * 3. DISCONNECTED alias.
00386  */
00387 static struct dentry *ll_find_alias(struct inode *inode, struct dentry *dentry)
00388 {
00389         struct dentry *alias, *discon_alias, *invalid_alias;
00390         DECLARE_LL_D_HLIST_NODE_PTR(p);
00391 
00392         if (ll_d_hlist_empty(&inode->i_dentry))
00393                 return NULL;
00394 
00395         discon_alias = invalid_alias = NULL;
00396 
00397         ll_lock_dcache(inode);
00398         ll_d_hlist_for_each_entry(alias, p, &inode->i_dentry) {
00399                 LASSERT(alias != dentry);
00400 
00401                 spin_lock(&alias->d_lock);
00402                 if (alias->d_flags & DCACHE_DISCONNECTED)
00403                         /* LASSERT(last_discon == NULL); LU-405, bz 20055 */
00404                         discon_alias = alias;
00405                 else if (alias->d_parent == dentry->d_parent             &&
00406                          alias->d_name.hash == dentry->d_name.hash       &&
00407                          alias->d_name.len == dentry->d_name.len         &&
00408                          memcmp(alias->d_name.name, dentry->d_name.name,
00409                                 dentry->d_name.len) == 0)
00410                         invalid_alias = alias;
00411                 spin_unlock(&alias->d_lock);
00412 
00413                 if (invalid_alias)
00414                         break;
00415         }
00416         alias = invalid_alias ?: discon_alias ?: NULL;
00417         if (alias) {
00418                 spin_lock(&alias->d_lock);
00419                 dget_dlock(alias);
00420                 spin_unlock(&alias->d_lock);
00421         }
00422         ll_unlock_dcache(inode);
00423 
00424         return alias;
00425 }
00426 
00427 /*
00428  * Similar to d_splice_alias(), but lustre treats invalid alias
00429  * similar to DCACHE_DISCONNECTED, and tries to use it anyway.
00430  */
00431 struct dentry *ll_splice_alias(struct inode *inode, struct dentry *de)
00432 {
00433         struct dentry *new;
00434         int rc;
00435 
00436         if (inode) {
00437                 new = ll_find_alias(inode, de);
00438                 if (new) {
00439                         rc = ll_d_init(new);
00440                         if (rc < 0) {
00441                                 dput(new);
00442                                 return ERR_PTR(rc);
00443                         }
00444                         d_move(new, de);
00445                         iput(inode);
00446                         CDEBUG(D_DENTRY,
00447                                "Reuse dentry %p inode %p refc %d flags %#x\n",
00448                               new, new->d_inode, ll_d_count(new), new->d_flags);
00449                         return new;
00450                 }
00451         }
00452         rc = ll_d_init(de);
00453         if (rc < 0)
00454                 return ERR_PTR(rc);
00455         d_add(de, inode);
00456         CDEBUG(D_DENTRY, "Add dentry %p inode %p refc %d flags %#x\n",
00457                de, de->d_inode, ll_d_count(de), de->d_flags);
00458         return de;
00459 }
00460 
00461 static int ll_lookup_it_finish(struct ptlrpc_request *request,
00462                                struct lookup_intent *it,
00463                                struct inode *parent, struct dentry **de)
00464 {
00465         struct inode             *inode = NULL;
00466         __u64                     bits = 0;
00467         int                       rc;
00468         ENTRY;
00469 
00470         /* NB 1 request reference will be taken away by ll_intent_lock()
00471          * when I return */
00472         CDEBUG(D_DENTRY, "it %p it_disposition %x\n", it,
00473                it->it_disposition);
00474         if (!it_disposition(it, DISP_LOOKUP_NEG)) {
00475                 rc = ll_prep_inode(&inode, request, (*de)->d_sb, it);
00476                 if (rc)
00477                         RETURN(rc);
00478 
00479                 ll_set_lock_data(ll_i2sbi(parent)->ll_md_exp, inode, it, &bits);
00480 
00481                 /* We used to query real size from OSTs here, but actually
00482                    this is not needed. For stat() calls size would be updated
00483                    from subsequent do_revalidate()->ll_inode_revalidate_it() in
00484                    2.4 and
00485                    vfs_getattr_it->ll_getattr()->ll_inode_revalidate_it() in 2.6
00486                    Everybody else who needs correct file size would call
00487                    ll_glimpse_size or some equivalent themselves anyway.
00488                    Also see bug 7198. */
00489         }
00490 
00491         /* Only hash *de if it is unhashed (new dentry).
00492          * Atoimc_open may passin hashed dentries for open.
00493          */
00494         if (d_unhashed(*de)) {
00495                 struct dentry *alias;
00496 
00497                 alias = ll_splice_alias(inode, *de);
00498                 if (IS_ERR(alias))
00499                         GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(alias));
00500 
00501                 *de = alias;
00502         } else if (!it_disposition(it, DISP_LOOKUP_NEG)  &&
00503                    !it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_CREATE)) {
00504                 /* With DISP_OPEN_CREATE dentry will
00505                    instantiated in ll_create_it. */
00506                 LASSERT((*de)->d_inode == NULL);
00507                 d_instantiate(*de, inode);
00508         }
00509 
00510         if (!it_disposition(it, DISP_LOOKUP_NEG)) {
00511                 /* we have lookup look - unhide dentry */
00512                 if (bits & MDS_INODELOCK_LOOKUP)
00513                         d_lustre_revalidate(*de);
00514         } else if (!it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_CREATE)) {
00515                 /* If file created on server, don't depend on parent UPDATE
00516                  * lock to unhide it. It is left hidden and next lookup can
00517                  * find it in ll_splice_alias.
00518                  */
00519                 /* Check that parent has UPDATE lock. */
00520                 struct lookup_intent parent_it = {
00521                                         .it_op = IT_GETATTR,
00522                                         .it_lock_handle = 0 };
00523                 struct lu_fid   fid = ll_i2info(parent)->lli_fid;
00524 
00525                 /* If it is striped directory, get the real stripe parent */
00526                 if (unlikely(ll_i2info(parent)->lli_lsm_md != NULL)) {
00527                         rc = md_get_fid_from_lsm(ll_i2mdexp(parent),
00528                                                  ll_i2info(parent)->lli_lsm_md,
00529                                                  (*de)->d_name.name,
00530                                                  (*de)->d_name.len, &fid);
00531                         if (rc != 0)
00532                                 GOTO(out, rc);
00533                 }
00534 
00535                 if (md_revalidate_lock(ll_i2mdexp(parent), &parent_it, &fid,
00536                                        NULL)) {
00537                         d_lustre_revalidate(*de);
00538                         ll_intent_release(&parent_it);
00539                 }
00540         }
00541 
00542         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00543 
00544 out:
00545         if (rc != 0 && it->it_op & IT_OPEN)
00546                 ll_open_cleanup((*de)->d_sb, request);
00547 
00548         return rc;
00549 }
00550 
00551 static struct dentry *ll_lookup_it(struct inode *parent, struct dentry *dentry,
00552                                    struct lookup_intent *it)
00553 {
00554         struct lookup_intent lookup_it = { .it_op = IT_LOOKUP };
00555         struct dentry *save = dentry, *retval;
00556         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
00557         struct md_op_data *op_data = NULL;
00558         __u32 opc;
00559         int rc;
00560         ENTRY;
00561 
00562         if (dentry->d_name.len > ll_i2sbi(parent)->ll_namelen)
00563                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENAMETOOLONG));
00564 
00565         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%.*s, dir="DFID"(%p), intent=%s\n",
00566                dentry->d_name.len, dentry->d_name.name,
00567                PFID(ll_inode2fid(parent)), parent, LL_IT2STR(it));
00568 
00569         if (d_mountpoint(dentry))
00570                 CERROR("Tell Peter, lookup on mtpt, it %s\n", LL_IT2STR(it));
00571 
00572         if (it == NULL || it->it_op == IT_GETXATTR)
00573                 it = &lookup_it;
00574 
00575         if (it->it_op == IT_GETATTR && dentry_may_statahead(parent, dentry)) {
00576                 rc = ll_statahead(parent, &dentry, 0);
00577                 if (rc == 1)
00578                         RETURN(dentry == save ? NULL : dentry);
00579         }
00580 
00581         if (it->it_op & IT_OPEN && it->it_flags & FMODE_WRITE &&
00582             dentry->d_sb->s_flags & MS_RDONLY)
00583                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-EROFS));
00584 
00585         if (it->it_op & IT_CREAT)
00586                 opc = LUSTRE_OPC_CREATE;
00587         else
00588                 opc = LUSTRE_OPC_ANY;
00589 
00590         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, parent, NULL, dentry->d_name.name,
00591                                      dentry->d_name.len, 0, opc, NULL);
00592         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
00593                 RETURN((void *)op_data);
00594 
00595         /* enforce umask if acl disabled or MDS doesn't support umask */
00596         if (!IS_POSIXACL(parent) || !exp_connect_umask(ll_i2mdexp(parent)))
00597                 it->it_create_mode &= ~current_umask();
00598 
00599         rc = md_intent_lock(ll_i2mdexp(parent), op_data, it, &req,
00600                             &ll_md_blocking_ast, 0);
00601         /* If the MDS allows the client to chgrp (CFS_SETGRP_PERM), but the
00602          * client does not know which suppgid should be sent to the MDS, or
00603          * some other(s) changed the target file's GID after this RPC sent
00604          * to the MDS with the suppgid as the original GID, then we should
00605          * try again with right suppgid. */
00606         if (rc == -EACCES && it->it_op & IT_OPEN &&
00607             it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_DENY)) {
00608                 struct mdt_body *body;
00609 
00610                 LASSERT(req != NULL);
00611 
00612                 body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00613                 if (op_data->op_suppgids[0] == body->mbo_gid ||
00614                     op_data->op_suppgids[1] == body->mbo_gid ||
00615                     !in_group_p(make_kgid(&init_user_ns, body->mbo_gid)))
00616                         GOTO(out, retval = ERR_PTR(-EACCES));
00617 
00618                 fid_zero(&op_data->op_fid2);
00619                 op_data->op_suppgids[1] = body->mbo_gid;
00620                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00621                 req = NULL;
00622                 ll_intent_release(it);
00623                 rc = md_intent_lock(ll_i2mdexp(parent), op_data, it, &req,
00624                                     &ll_md_blocking_ast, 0);
00625         }
00626 
00627         if (rc < 0)
00628                 GOTO(out, retval = ERR_PTR(rc));
00629 
00630         rc = ll_lookup_it_finish(req, it, parent, &dentry);
00631         if (rc != 0) {
00632                 ll_intent_release(it);
00633                 GOTO(out, retval = ERR_PTR(rc));
00634         }
00635 
00636         if ((it->it_op & IT_OPEN) && dentry->d_inode &&
00637             !S_ISREG(dentry->d_inode->i_mode) &&
00638             !S_ISDIR(dentry->d_inode->i_mode)) {
00639                 ll_release_openhandle(dentry, it);
00640         }
00641         ll_lookup_finish_locks(it, dentry);
00642 
00643         GOTO(out, retval = (dentry == save) ? NULL : dentry);
00644 
00645 out:
00646         if (op_data != NULL && !IS_ERR(op_data))
00647                 ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
00648 
00649         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00650         return retval;
00651 }
00652 
00653 #ifdef HAVE_IOP_ATOMIC_OPEN
00654 static struct dentry *ll_lookup_nd(struct inode *parent, struct dentry *dentry,
00655                                    unsigned int flags)
00656 {
00657         struct lookup_intent *itp, it = { .it_op = IT_GETATTR };
00658         struct dentry *de;
00659 
00660         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%.*s, dir="DFID"(%p), flags=%u\n",
00661                dentry->d_name.len, dentry->d_name.name,
00662                PFID(ll_inode2fid(parent)), parent, flags);
00663 
00664         /* Optimize away (CREATE && !OPEN). Let .create handle the race. */
00665         if ((flags & LOOKUP_CREATE) && !(flags & LOOKUP_OPEN))
00666                 return NULL;
00667 
00668         if (flags & (LOOKUP_PARENT|LOOKUP_OPEN|LOOKUP_CREATE))
00669                 itp = NULL;
00670         else
00671                 itp = &it;
00672         de = ll_lookup_it(parent, dentry, itp);
00673 
00674         if (itp != NULL)
00675                 ll_intent_release(itp);
00676 
00677         return de;
00678 }
00679 
00680 /*
00681  * For cached negative dentry and new dentry, handle lookup/create/open
00682  * together.
00683  */
00684 static int ll_atomic_open(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dentry,
00685                           struct file *file, unsigned open_flags,
00686                           umode_t mode, int *opened)
00687 {
00688         struct lookup_intent *it;
00689         struct dentry *de;
00690         long long lookup_flags = LOOKUP_OPEN;
00691         int rc = 0;
00692         ENTRY;
00693 
00694         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%.*s, dir="DFID"(%p), file %p,"
00695                            "open_flags %x, mode %x opened %d\n",
00696                dentry->d_name.len, dentry->d_name.name,
00697                PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)), dir, file, open_flags, mode, *opened);
00698 
00699         OBD_ALLOC(it, sizeof(*it));
00700         if (!it)
00701                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00702 
00703         it->it_op = IT_OPEN;
00704         if (open_flags & O_CREAT) {
00705                 it->it_op |= IT_CREAT;
00706                 lookup_flags |= LOOKUP_CREATE;
00707         }
00708         it->it_create_mode = (mode & S_IALLUGO) | S_IFREG;
00709         it->it_flags = (open_flags & ~O_ACCMODE) | OPEN_FMODE(open_flags);
00710         it->it_flags &= ~MDS_OPEN_FL_INTERNAL;
00711 
00712         /* Dentry added to dcache tree in ll_lookup_it */
00713         de = ll_lookup_it(dir, dentry, it);
00714         if (IS_ERR(de))
00715                 rc = PTR_ERR(de);
00716         else if (de != NULL)
00717                 dentry = de;
00718 
00719         if (!rc) {
00720                 if (it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_CREATE)) {
00721                         /* Dentry instantiated in ll_create_it. */
00722                         rc = ll_create_it(dir, dentry, it);
00723                         if (rc) {
00724                                 /* We dget in ll_splice_alias. */
00725                                 if (de != NULL)
00726                                         dput(de);
00727                                 goto out_release;
00728                         }
00729 
00730                         *opened |= FILE_CREATED;
00731                 }
00732                 if (dentry->d_inode && it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_OPEN)) {
00733                         /* Open dentry. */
00734                         if (S_ISFIFO(dentry->d_inode->i_mode)) {
00735                                 /* We cannot call open here as it might
00736                                  * deadlock. This case is unreachable in
00737                                  * practice because of OBD_CONNECT_NODEVOH. */
00738                                 rc = finish_no_open(file, de);
00739                         } else {
00740                                 file->private_data = it;
00741                                 rc = finish_open(file, dentry, NULL, opened);
00742                                 /* We dget in ll_splice_alias. finish_open takes
00743                                  * care of dget for fd open.
00744                                  */
00745                                 if (de != NULL)
00746                                         dput(de);
00747                         }
00748                 } else {
00749                         rc = finish_no_open(file, de);
00750                 }
00751         }
00752 
00753 out_release:
00754         ll_intent_release(it);
00755         OBD_FREE(it, sizeof(*it));
00756 
00757         RETURN(rc);
00758 }
00759 
00760 #else /* !HAVE_IOP_ATOMIC_OPEN */
00761 static struct lookup_intent *
00762 ll_convert_intent(struct open_intent *oit, int lookup_flags)
00763 {
00764         struct lookup_intent *it;
00765 
00766         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(it);
00767         if (!it)
00768                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00769 
00770         if (lookup_flags & LOOKUP_OPEN) {
00771                 it->it_op = IT_OPEN;
00772                 if (lookup_flags & LOOKUP_CREATE)
00773                         it->it_op |= IT_CREAT;
00774                 it->it_create_mode = (oit->create_mode & S_IALLUGO) | S_IFREG;
00775                 it->it_flags = ll_namei_to_lookup_intent_flag(oit->flags);
00776                 it->it_flags &= ~MDS_OPEN_FL_INTERNAL;
00777         } else {
00778                 it->it_op = IT_GETATTR;
00779         }
00780 
00781         return it;
00782 }
00783 
00784 static struct dentry *ll_lookup_nd(struct inode *parent, struct dentry *dentry,
00785                                    struct nameidata *nd)
00786 {
00787         struct dentry *de;
00788         ENTRY;
00789 
00790         if (nd && !(nd->flags & (LOOKUP_CONTINUE|LOOKUP_PARENT))) {
00791                 struct lookup_intent *it;
00792 
00793                 if (ll_d2d(dentry) && ll_d2d(dentry)->lld_it) {
00794                         it = ll_d2d(dentry)->lld_it;
00795                         ll_d2d(dentry)->lld_it = NULL;
00796                 } else {
00797                         if ((nd->flags & LOOKUP_CREATE) &&
00798                             !(nd->flags & LOOKUP_OPEN))
00799                                 RETURN(NULL);
00800 
00801                         it = ll_convert_intent(&nd->intent.open, nd->flags);
00802                         if (IS_ERR(it))
00803                                 RETURN((struct dentry *)it);
00804                 }
00805 
00806                 de = ll_lookup_it(parent, dentry, it);
00807                 if (de)
00808                         dentry = de;
00809                 if ((nd->flags & LOOKUP_OPEN) && !IS_ERR(dentry)) { /* Open */
00810                         if (dentry->d_inode &&
00811                             it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_OPEN)) { /* nocreate */
00812                                 if (S_ISFIFO(dentry->d_inode->i_mode)) {
00813                                         /* We cannot call open here as it might
00814                                          * deadlock. This case is unreachable in
00815                                          * practice because of
00816                                          * OBD_CONNECT_NODEVOH. */
00817                                 } else {
00818                                         struct file *filp;
00819 
00820                                         nd->intent.open.file->private_data = it;
00821                                         filp = lookup_instantiate_filp(nd,
00822                                                                        dentry,
00823                                                                        NULL);
00824                                         if (IS_ERR(filp)) {
00825                                                 if (de)
00826                                                         dput(de);
00827                                                 de = (struct dentry *)filp;
00828                                         }
00829                                 }
00830                         } else if (it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_CREATE)) {
00831                                 // XXX This can only reliably work on assumption
00832                                 // that there are NO hashed negative dentries.
00833                                 ll_d2d(dentry)->lld_it = it;
00834                                 it = NULL; /* Will be freed in ll_create_nd */
00835                                 /* We absolutely depend on ll_create_nd to be
00836                                  * called to not leak this intent and possible
00837                                  * data attached to it */
00838                         }
00839                 }
00840 
00841                 if (it) {
00842                         ll_intent_release(it);
00843                         OBD_FREE(it, sizeof(*it));
00844                 }
00845         } else {
00846                 de = ll_lookup_it(parent, dentry, NULL);
00847         }
00848 
00849         RETURN(de);
00850 }
00851 #endif /* HAVE_IOP_ATOMIC_OPEN */
00852 
00853 /* We depend on "mode" being set with the proper file type/umask by now */
00854 static struct inode *ll_create_node(struct inode *dir, struct lookup_intent *it)
00855 {
00856         struct inode *inode = NULL;
00857         struct ptlrpc_request *request = NULL;
00858         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(dir);
00859         int rc;
00860         ENTRY;
00861 
00862         LASSERT(it && it->it_disposition);
00863 
00864         LASSERT(it_disposition(it, DISP_ENQ_CREATE_REF));
00865         request = it->it_request;
00866         it_clear_disposition(it, DISP_ENQ_CREATE_REF);
00867         rc = ll_prep_inode(&inode, request, dir->i_sb, it);
00868         if (rc)
00869                 GOTO(out, inode = ERR_PTR(rc));
00870 
00871         LASSERT(ll_d_hlist_empty(&inode->i_dentry));
00872 
00873         /* We asked for a lock on the directory, but were granted a
00874          * lock on the inode.  Since we finally have an inode pointer,
00875          * stuff it in the lock. */
00876         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "setting l_ast_data to inode "DFID"(%p)\n",
00877                PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), inode);
00878         ll_set_lock_data(sbi->ll_md_exp, inode, it, NULL);
00879         EXIT;
00880  out:
00881         ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
00882         return inode;
00883 }
00884 
00885 /*
00886  * By the time this is called, we already have created the directory cache
00887  * entry for the new file, but it is so far negative - it has no inode.
00888  *
00889  * We defer creating the OBD object(s) until open, to keep the intent and
00890  * non-intent code paths similar, and also because we do not have the MDS
00891  * inode number before calling ll_create_node() (which is needed for LOV),
00892  * so we would need to do yet another RPC to the MDS to store the LOV EA
00893  * data on the MDS.  If needed, we would pass the PACKED lmm as data and
00894  * lmm_size in datalen (the MDS still has code which will handle that).
00895  *
00896  * If the create succeeds, we fill in the inode information
00897  * with d_instantiate().
00898  */
00899 static int ll_create_it(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dentry,
00900                         struct lookup_intent *it)
00901 {
00902         struct inode *inode;
00903         int rc = 0;
00904         ENTRY;
00905 
00906         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%.*s, dir="DFID"(%p), intent=%s\n",
00907                dentry->d_name.len, dentry->d_name.name,
00908                PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)), dir, LL_IT2STR(it));
00909 
00910         rc = it_open_error(DISP_OPEN_CREATE, it);
00911         if (rc)
00912                 RETURN(rc);
00913 
00914         inode = ll_create_node(dir, it);
00915         if (IS_ERR(inode))
00916                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(inode));
00917 
00918         d_instantiate(dentry, inode);
00919 
00920         rc = ll_init_security(dentry, inode, dir);
00921         if (rc)
00922                 RETURN(rc);
00923 
00924         RETURN(0);
00925 }
00926 
00927 void ll_update_times(struct ptlrpc_request *request, struct inode *inode)
00928 {
00929         struct mdt_body *body = req_capsule_server_get(&request->rq_pill,
00930                                                        &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00931 
00932         LASSERT(body);
00933         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLMTIME &&
00934             body->mbo_mtime > LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime)) {
00935                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "setting fid "DFID" mtime from %lu to "LPU64
00936                        "\n", PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)),
00937                        LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime), body->mbo_mtime);
00938                 LTIME_S(inode->i_mtime) = body->mbo_mtime;
00939         }
00940 
00941         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLCTIME &&
00942             body->mbo_ctime > LTIME_S(inode->i_ctime))
00943                 LTIME_S(inode->i_ctime) = body->mbo_ctime;
00944 }
00945 
00946 static int ll_new_node(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dchild,
00947                        const char *tgt, umode_t mode, int rdev, __u32 opc)
00948 {
00949         struct qstr *name = &dchild->d_name;
00950         struct ptlrpc_request *request = NULL;
00951         struct md_op_data *op_data;
00952         struct inode *inode = NULL;
00953         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(dir);
00954         int tgt_len = 0;
00955         int err;
00956 
00957         ENTRY;
00958         if (unlikely(tgt != NULL))
00959                 tgt_len = strlen(tgt) + 1;
00960 
00961 again:
00962         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, dir, NULL, name->name,
00963                                      name->len, 0, opc, NULL);
00964         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
00965                 GOTO(err_exit, err = PTR_ERR(op_data));
00966 
00967         err = md_create(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data, tgt, tgt_len, mode,
00968                         from_kuid(&init_user_ns, current_fsuid()),
00969                         from_kgid(&init_user_ns, current_fsgid()),
00970                         cfs_curproc_cap_pack(), rdev, &request);
00971         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
00972         if (err < 0 && err != -EREMOTE)
00973                 GOTO(err_exit, err);
00974 
00975         /* If the client doesn't know where to create a subdirectory (or
00976          * in case of a race that sends the RPC to the wrong MDS), the
00977          * MDS will return -EREMOTE and the client will fetch the layout
00978          * of the directory, then create the directory on the right MDT. */
00979         if (unlikely(err == -EREMOTE)) {
00980                 struct ll_inode_info    *lli = ll_i2info(dir);
00981                 struct lmv_user_md      *lum;
00982                 int                     lumsize;
00983                 int                     err2;
00984 
00985                 ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
00986                 request = NULL;
00987 
00988                 err2 = ll_dir_getstripe(dir, (void **)&lum, &lumsize, &request,
00989                                         OBD_MD_DEFAULT_MEA);
00990                 if (err2 == 0) {
00991                         /* Update stripe_offset and retry */
00992                         lli->lli_def_stripe_offset = lum->lum_stripe_offset;
00993                 } else if (err2 == -ENODATA &&
00994                            lli->lli_def_stripe_offset != -1) {
00995                         /* If there are no default stripe EA on the MDT, but the
00996                          * client has default stripe, then it probably means
00997                          * default stripe EA has just been deleted. */
00998                         lli->lli_def_stripe_offset = -1;
00999                 } else {
01000                         GOTO(err_exit, err);
01001                 }
01002 
01003                 ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
01004                 request = NULL;
01005                 goto again;
01006         }
01007 
01008         ll_update_times(request, dir);
01009 
01010         err = ll_prep_inode(&inode, request, dchild->d_sb, NULL);
01011         if (err)
01012                 GOTO(err_exit, err);
01013 
01014         d_instantiate(dchild, inode);
01015 
01016         err = ll_init_security(dchild, inode, dir);
01017         if (err)
01018                 GOTO(err_exit, err);
01019 
01020         EXIT;
01021 err_exit:
01022         if (request != NULL)
01023                 ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
01024 
01025         return err;
01026 }
01027 
01028 static int ll_mknod(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dchild, ll_umode_t mode,
01029                     dev_t rdev)
01030 {
01031         struct qstr *name = &dchild->d_name;
01032         int err;
01033         ENTRY;
01034 
01035         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%.*s, dir="DFID"(%p) mode %o dev %x\n",
01036                name->len, name->name, PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)), dir,
01037                mode, rdev);
01038 
01039         if (!IS_POSIXACL(dir) || !exp_connect_umask(ll_i2mdexp(dir)))
01040                 mode &= ~current_umask();
01041 
01042         switch (mode & S_IFMT) {
01043         case 0:
01044                 mode |= S_IFREG; /* for mode = 0 case, fallthrough */
01045         case S_IFREG:
01046         case S_IFCHR:
01047         case S_IFBLK:
01048         case S_IFIFO:
01049         case S_IFSOCK:
01050                 err = ll_new_node(dir, dchild, NULL, mode, old_encode_dev(rdev),
01051                                   LUSTRE_OPC_MKNOD);
01052                 break;
01053         case S_IFDIR:
01054                 err = -EPERM;
01055                 break;
01056         default:
01057                 err = -EINVAL;
01058         }
01059 
01060         if (!err)
01061                 ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(dir), LPROC_LL_MKNOD, 1);
01062 
01063         RETURN(err);
01064 }
01065 
01066 #ifdef HAVE_IOP_ATOMIC_OPEN
01067 /*
01068  * Plain create. Intent create is handled in atomic_open.
01069  */
01070 static int ll_create_nd(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dentry,
01071                         umode_t mode, bool want_excl)
01072 {
01073         int rc;
01074 
01075         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%.*s, dir="DFID"(%p), "
01076                            "flags=%u, excl=%d\n", dentry->d_name.len,
01077                dentry->d_name.name, PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)),
01078                dir, mode, want_excl);
01079 
01080         rc = ll_mknod(dir, dentry, mode, 0);
01081 
01082         ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(dir), LPROC_LL_CREATE, 1);
01083 
01084         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%.*s, unhashed %d\n",
01085                dentry->d_name.len, dentry->d_name.name, d_unhashed(dentry));
01086 
01087         return rc;
01088 }
01089 #else /* !HAVE_IOP_ATOMIC_OPEN */
01090 static int ll_create_nd(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dentry,
01091                         ll_umode_t mode, struct nameidata *nd)
01092 {
01093         struct ll_dentry_data *lld = ll_d2d(dentry);
01094         struct lookup_intent *it = NULL;
01095         int rc;
01096 
01097         if (lld != NULL)
01098                 it = lld->lld_it;
01099 
01100         if (!it)
01101                 return ll_mknod(dir, dentry, mode, 0);
01102 
01103         lld->lld_it = NULL;
01104 
01105         /* Was there an error? Propagate it! */
01106         if (it->it_status) {
01107                 rc = it->it_status;
01108                 goto out;
01109         }
01110 
01111         rc = ll_create_it(dir, dentry, it);
01112         if (nd && (nd->flags & LOOKUP_OPEN) && dentry->d_inode) { /* Open */
01113                 struct file *filp;
01114 
01115                 nd->intent.open.file->private_data = it;
01116                 filp = lookup_instantiate_filp(nd, dentry, NULL);
01117                 if (IS_ERR(filp))
01118                         rc = PTR_ERR(filp);
01119         }
01120 
01121 out:
01122         ll_intent_release(it);
01123         OBD_FREE(it, sizeof(*it));
01124 
01125         if (!rc)
01126                 ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(dir), LPROC_LL_CREATE, 1);
01127 
01128         return rc;
01129 }
01130 #endif /* HAVE_IOP_ATOMIC_OPEN */
01131 
01132 static int ll_symlink(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dchild,
01133                       const char *oldpath)
01134 {
01135         struct qstr *name = &dchild->d_name;
01136         int err;
01137         ENTRY;
01138 
01139         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%.*s, dir="DFID"(%p), target=%.*s\n",
01140                name->len, name->name, PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)),
01141                dir, 3000, oldpath);
01142 
01143         err = ll_new_node(dir, dchild, oldpath, S_IFLNK | S_IRWXUGO, 0,
01144                           LUSTRE_OPC_SYMLINK);
01145 
01146         if (!err)
01147                 ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(dir), LPROC_LL_SYMLINK, 1);
01148 
01149         RETURN(err);
01150 }
01151 
01152 static int ll_link(struct dentry *old_dentry, struct inode *dir,
01153                    struct dentry *new_dentry)
01154 {
01155         struct inode *src = old_dentry->d_inode;
01156         struct qstr *name = &new_dentry->d_name;
01157         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(dir);
01158         struct ptlrpc_request *request = NULL;
01159         struct md_op_data *op_data;
01160         int err;
01161 
01162         ENTRY;
01163         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op: inode="DFID"(%p), dir="DFID"(%p), "
01164                "target=%.*s\n", PFID(ll_inode2fid(src)), src,
01165                PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)), dir, name->len, name->name);
01166 
01167         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, src, dir, name->name, name->len,
01168                                      0, LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, NULL);
01169         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
01170                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(op_data));
01171 
01172         err = md_link(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data, &request);
01173         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
01174         if (err)
01175                 GOTO(out, err);
01176 
01177         ll_update_times(request, dir);
01178         ll_stats_ops_tally(sbi, LPROC_LL_LINK, 1);
01179         EXIT;
01180 out:
01181         ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
01182         RETURN(err);
01183 }
01184 
01185 static int ll_mkdir(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dchild, ll_umode_t mode)
01186 {
01187         struct qstr *name = &dchild->d_name;
01188         int err;
01189         ENTRY;
01190 
01191         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%.*s, dir="DFID"(%p)\n",
01192                name->len, name->name, PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)), dir);
01193 
01194         if (!IS_POSIXACL(dir) || !exp_connect_umask(ll_i2mdexp(dir)))
01195                 mode &= ~current_umask();
01196 
01197         mode = (mode & (S_IRWXUGO|S_ISVTX)) | S_IFDIR;
01198 
01199         err = ll_new_node(dir, dchild, NULL, mode, 0, LUSTRE_OPC_MKDIR);
01200         if (err == 0)
01201                 ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(dir), LPROC_LL_MKDIR, 1);
01202 
01203         RETURN(err);
01204 }
01205 
01206 static int ll_rmdir(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dchild)
01207 {
01208         struct qstr *name = &dchild->d_name;
01209         struct ptlrpc_request *request = NULL;
01210         struct md_op_data *op_data;
01211         int rc;
01212         ENTRY;
01213 
01214         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%.*s, dir="DFID"(%p)\n",
01215                name->len, name->name, PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)), dir);
01216 
01217         if (unlikely(d_mountpoint(dchild)))
01218                 RETURN(-EBUSY);
01219 
01220         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, dir, NULL, name->name, name->len,
01221                                      S_IFDIR, LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, NULL);
01222         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
01223                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(op_data));
01224 
01225         if (dchild->d_inode != NULL)
01226                 op_data->op_fid3 = *ll_inode2fid(dchild->d_inode);
01227 
01228         op_data->op_fid2 = op_data->op_fid3;
01229         rc = md_unlink(ll_i2sbi(dir)->ll_md_exp, op_data, &request);
01230         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
01231         if (rc == 0) {
01232                 ll_update_times(request, dir);
01233                 ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(dir), LPROC_LL_RMDIR, 1);
01234         }
01235 
01236         ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
01237         RETURN(rc);
01238 }
01239 
01243 int ll_rmdir_entry(struct inode *dir, char *name, int namelen)
01244 {
01245         struct ptlrpc_request *request = NULL;
01246         struct md_op_data *op_data;
01247         int rc;
01248         ENTRY;
01249 
01250         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%.*s, dir="DFID"(%p)\n",
01251                namelen, name, PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)), dir);
01252 
01253         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, dir, NULL, name, strlen(name),
01254                                      S_IFDIR, LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, NULL);
01255         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
01256                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(op_data));
01257         op_data->op_cli_flags |= CLI_RM_ENTRY;
01258         rc = md_unlink(ll_i2sbi(dir)->ll_md_exp, op_data, &request);
01259         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
01260         if (rc == 0) {
01261                 ll_update_times(request, dir);
01262                 ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(dir), LPROC_LL_RMDIR, 1);
01263         }
01264 
01265         ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
01266         RETURN(rc);
01267 }
01268 
01269 /* ll_unlink() doesn't update the inode with the new link count.
01270  * Instead, ll_ddelete() and ll_d_iput() will update it based upon if
01271  * there is any lock existing. They will recycle dentries and inodes
01272  * based upon locks too. b=20433 */
01273 static int ll_unlink(struct inode *dir, struct dentry *dchild)
01274 {
01275         struct qstr *name = &dchild->d_name;
01276         struct ptlrpc_request *request = NULL;
01277         struct md_op_data *op_data;
01278         int rc;
01279         ENTRY;
01280         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:name=%.*s, dir="DFID"(%p)\n",
01281                name->len, name->name, PFID(ll_inode2fid(dir)), dir);
01282 
01283         /*
01284          * XXX: unlink bind mountpoint maybe call to here,
01285          * just check it as vfs_unlink does.
01286          */
01287         if (unlikely(d_mountpoint(dchild)))
01288                 RETURN(-EBUSY);
01289 
01290         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, dir, NULL, name->name, name->len, 0,
01291                                      LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, NULL);
01292         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
01293                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(op_data));
01294 
01295         if (dchild->d_inode != NULL)
01296                 op_data->op_fid3 = *ll_inode2fid(dchild->d_inode);
01297 
01298         op_data->op_fid2 = op_data->op_fid3;
01299         rc = md_unlink(ll_i2sbi(dir)->ll_md_exp, op_data, &request);
01300         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
01301         if (rc)
01302                 GOTO(out, rc);
01303 
01304         ll_update_times(request, dir);
01305         ll_stats_ops_tally(ll_i2sbi(dir), LPROC_LL_UNLINK, 1);
01306 
01307  out:
01308         ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
01309         RETURN(rc);
01310 }
01311 
01312 static int ll_rename(struct inode *src, struct dentry *src_dchild,
01313                      struct inode *tgt, struct dentry *tgt_dchild)
01314 {
01315         struct qstr *src_name = &src_dchild->d_name;
01316         struct qstr *tgt_name = &tgt_dchild->d_name;
01317         struct ptlrpc_request *request = NULL;
01318         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(src);
01319         struct md_op_data *op_data;
01320         int err;
01321         ENTRY;
01322         CDEBUG(D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op:oldname=%.*s, src_dir="DFID
01323                "(%p), newname=%.*s, tgt_dir="DFID"(%p)\n",
01324                src_name->len, src_name->name,
01325                PFID(ll_inode2fid(src)), src, tgt_name->len,
01326                tgt_name->name, PFID(ll_inode2fid(tgt)), tgt);
01327 
01328         if (unlikely(d_mountpoint(src_dchild) || d_mountpoint(tgt_dchild)))
01329                 RETURN(-EBUSY);
01330 
01331         op_data = ll_prep_md_op_data(NULL, src, tgt, NULL, 0, 0,
01332                                      LUSTRE_OPC_ANY, NULL);
01333         if (IS_ERR(op_data))
01334                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(op_data));
01335 
01336         if (src_dchild->d_inode != NULL)
01337                 op_data->op_fid3 = *ll_inode2fid(src_dchild->d_inode);
01338 
01339         if (tgt_dchild->d_inode != NULL)
01340                 op_data->op_fid4 = *ll_inode2fid(tgt_dchild->d_inode);
01341 
01342         err = md_rename(sbi->ll_md_exp, op_data,
01343                         src_name->name, src_name->len,
01344                         tgt_name->name, tgt_name->len, &request);
01345         ll_finish_md_op_data(op_data);
01346         if (!err) {
01347                 ll_update_times(request, src);
01348                 ll_update_times(request, tgt);
01349                 ll_stats_ops_tally(sbi, LPROC_LL_RENAME, 1);
01350         }
01351 
01352         ptlrpc_req_finished(request);
01353 
01354         if (err == 0)
01355                 d_move(src_dchild, tgt_dchild);
01356 
01357         RETURN(err);
01358 }
01359

01364 #endif
01365         .lookup             = ll_lookup_nd,
01366         .create             = ll_create_nd,
01367         /* We need all these non-raw things for NFSD, to not patch it. */
01368         .unlink             = ll_unlink,
01369         .mkdir              = ll_mkdir,
01370         .rmdir              = ll_rmdir,
01371         .symlink            = ll_symlink,
01372         .link               = ll_link,
01373         .rename             = ll_rename,
01374         .setattr            = ll_setattr,
01375         .getattr            = ll_getattr,
01376         .permission         = ll_inode_permission,
01377         .setxattr           = ll_setxattr,
01378         .getxattr           = ll_getxattr,
01379         .listxattr          = ll_listxattr,
01380         .removexattr        = ll_removexattr,
01381 #ifdef HAVE_IOP_GET_ACL
01382         .get_acl            = ll_get_acl,
01383 #endif
01384 };
